What is the primary purpose of Git?
options: To track changes in source code during software development

questions.question: Which command is used to initialize a new Git repository?
What is the purpose of git add?
options: To stage changes for the next commit
To push changes to a remote repository

questions.question: Which command is used to save the staged changes to the repository?
What does git status do?
options: Shows the list of remote repositories
Shows the branches of the repository

questions.question: Which command is used to create a new branch?
What is the purpose of git push?
options: To download changes from a remote repository
To upload local commits to a remote repository

questions.question: Which command is used to retrieve changes from a remote repository?
What does git log display?
options: The current status of the working directory

questions.question: Which command is used to switch between branches?
What is a 'commit' in Git?
options: A snapshot of the repository at a specific point in time
A connection to a remote repository

questions.question: What is the difference between git fetch and git pull?
options: git fetch downloads commits, git pull downloads and merges
git pull downloads commits, git fetch downloads and merges
git fetch only works on local branches

questions.question: Which command is used to see the differences between the working directory and the staging area?
What does git clone do?
options: Copies an existing remote repository to your local machine

questions.question: What is a 'remote' in Git?
options: A repository hosted on a server

questions.question: Which command is used to undo the last commit?
What is a 'fork' in Git?
options: A way to copy a repository to your own account

questions.question: What command is used to merge a branch into your current branch?
What is a 'pull request' (or merge request)?
options: A way to download changes from a remote repository
A mechanism to propose changes to a repository and discuss them
A command to create a new branch
A way to discard local changes

questions.question: What is the purpose of a .gitignore file?
options: To specify which files to track
To specify which files to ignore (not track) in Git

questions.question: What is Docker primarily used for?
What is a Docker image?
options: A running instance of a container
A read-only template with instructions for creating a Docker container
A file that stores container logs
A configuration file for Docker networks

options: A read-only template for creating applications
A running instance of a Docker image
A way to manage Docker images

questions.question: Which command is used to build a Docker image from a Dockerfile?

options: To define the steps for building a Docker image

questions.question: Which command is used to start a Docker container?
What does the docker ps command do?

options: To define and manage multi-container Docker applications
To run a single Docker container

questions.question: What does the docker stop command do?
options: Stops a running Docker container gracefully

questions.question: What is a Docker volume used for?
options: To persist data generated by and used by Docker containers

questions.question: Which instruction in a Dockerfile is used to copy files from the host to the container?
What command lists all Docker images on your system?
What does the docker exec command do?
options: Runs a command in a running container

questions.question: What is the default port that Docker daemon listens on?
What is the purpose of the EXPOSE instruction in a Dockerfile?
options: To specify which files to copy into the image
To inform Docker that the container listens on the specified network ports at runtime
To run a command when the container starts

questions.question: Which command removes a Docker container?
What does docker logs do?
options: Fetches the logs of a container

questions.question: What is a Docker network?
options: A way to share files between host and container
A mechanism for containers to communicate with each other and the outside world

questions.question: What does the docker push command do?
options: Downloads an image from a registry
Uploads a local image to a registry
Builds an image from a Dockerfile
